Dispersion¶

pycis.model.dispersion.calculate_dispersion(wavelength, material, source=None)[source]¶

Calculate the birefringence and refractive indices of a material as a function of wavelength.

Parameters

  • wavelength (float, np.array, xr.DataArray) – Wavelength(s) with units m.

  • material (str) – Specifies the material.

  • source (str) – Specifies source of dispersion info.

Returns

A tuple of (birefringence, extraordinary refractive index, ordinary refractive index).

pycis.model.dispersion.calculate_kappa(wavelength, material, source=None)[source]¶

Calculate kappa for a material, the unitless first-order dispersion parameter, as a function of wavelength.

Parameters

  • wavelength (float, np.array, xr.DataArray) – Wavelength(s) in units m.

  • material (str) – Specifies the material.

  • source (str) – Specifies source of dispersion info.

Returns

Dispersion parameter kappa.
